file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-11-17-04 - HF CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL HF CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the HF Power contactor. B. The HF Power contactor is installed in the RH Electrical-power control/distribution box. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 23-11-17-000-801-A HF POWER CONTACTOR - REMOVAL HF POWER CONTACTOR - INSTALLA- ALL 23-11-17-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 23-11-17 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-11-17-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. HF POWER CONTACTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the HF Power contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH cockpit/pax partition I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the overhead panel, is set to OFF. (2) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag, on GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are set to OFF. (4) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag, on BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (5) Set the BACKUP pushbutton, on the overhead panel, to OFF. (6) Put a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag, on BACKUP pushbutton. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-11-17 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) To get access to the HF Power contactor RH electrical-power control/distribution box, remove the 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (2). (2) Remove the screws (3), washers (4) and electrical wire (5). NOTE: If the electrical cables are without an identification code, identify them to make the reinstallation easier. (3) Remove the HF Power contactor (1) from the electrical-power control/distribution box. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-11-17 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL HF Power Contactor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 224 B 224NZ A DET. A ZONE 223 C DET. B RIGHT POWER CONTROL AND DISTRIBUTION BOX 5. ELECTRICAL WIRE (2) 4. WASHER (2) 3. SCREW (2) 1 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 1. HF CONTACTOR (K1230) DET. C 1 TORQUE: 4.0 - 4.4 N.m (35.3 - 39.0 lb.in) EM145AMM231218A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-11-17 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-11-17-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. HF POWER CONTACTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the HF Power contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 AMM TASK 23-11-00-700-803-A/500 HF SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To apply the torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH cockpit/pax partition I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the HF Power contactor (1) in the electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). (2) Install the screws (3), washers (4) and the electrical wire (5) that attach the HF Power contactor (1) in the electrical-power control/distribution box. (3) Use the torque wrench to torque nut (3) to 4.0 - 4.4 N.m (35.3 - 39 lbf.in). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-11-17 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Apply a drop of torque seal F-925 to the nut (3) as a check mark. (5) Connect the electrical connector (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the BACKUP pushbutton. (3) Set the BACKUP pushbutton to AUTO. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (5) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag from BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (6) Do the Operational Check of the HF System ( AMM TASK 23-11-00-700-803-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-11-17 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
